div.p: You go, and I will go and look for Paris, to call him, . . . . . carrier of woe? . . . . . [if perhaps he wishes] to hear what I have to say. I wish for him the earth [would gape right] now; for the Olympian reared him as a great source of pain [for the Trojans] and for great-hearted Priam and his children. [If I were to see] him having gone down into Hades, [I would say] that my own mind had forgotten its painful grief. [Thus he spoke,] nor did Hecuba disobey, but quickly called [to her maids,] and they gathered together the older women throughout the city. [But she went] down to the sweet-smelling chamber, [Made of cedar] which contained many noble treasures [. . .] queenly among women, she stood beside the chests [Where her] many-colored robes were, the work of Sidonian [Women, whom] godlike Alexand[er himself] [Had led from Sidon] when he sail[ed the wide sea,] [That journey on which he brought back He]le[n of the noble father.]
